Absolutely a blast to play with friends. If you are a fan of cult classic horror characters and killers there's plenty of that for you here. It does have a quite high learning curve if you want to play this on high ranking matches from either side. The base game will give you pretty much all the survivor cross-character (called teacheables) skills you need. If you want to main killer you will have to invest a little bit on DLCs as some of the best teacheables for killers are from DLC killers. You do not need the DLCs to play DLC maps, since players who has them can use the item to summon the map. As a downside, I could say it's quite grindy to get all the skills to make the builds you may want and you do need to restart your character 3 times if you want the experienced player unique outfits + high appear rate of special items (That can turn around a match). If you get hooked (Pun intended) to the game, there's thousands of hours here for you. If you want to play it casually alone you may not get the most of it. DLCs, microtransactions and the game pass do not offer any kind of advatage at all over other players with just the base game, so I recommend trying the base game at least.

The developers hold monopoly over the genre, which means the devs can pull anything they like and we just have to roll with it, essentially forcing those of us who enjoy 4v1 horror survival games to play this one while praying some other developer is able to compete against this one. 
Horrible balancing, terrible map design, cool killer concepts but poorly executed.
Devs are running out of ideas on killer powers so new killers are just hybrids (i.e Onryo just being a mix of wraith, spirit and Freddy) or budget versions of old ones (i.e Trickster being a cheaper huntress). OG cast is getting neglected (RIP Billy), and newer killers performance are so basic that they are quickly forgotten in favour of Nurse, Spirit, Huntress and Blight.
With the introduction of a hidden MMR system, the focus has changed to kills verses escapes, so survivors run gen rushing builds and chase extending builds, while killers are forced to proxy camp and tunnel their way to victory.
While the devs are problematic in their own way, the worst aspect of this game is the community.
Half of the community are snowflakes who complain about bming and consistently try to bring their drama onto your steam profile or private messages. They whinge about the other side bringing strong items and meta perks into the game. These same people will also complain if you try memey builds (stop complaining about facecamping insidious bubbas, headon builds ffs). There is also a portion of the community who will tell you to [spoiler]commit suicide or they will tell you they hope your mother gets r***ed[/spoiler]
Essentially if you have fun you're an asshole, and if you play to win you're not just an asshole, you're a sweaty asshole.

6/28/21 UPDATE:

As of right now, I have accumulated 1.5k hours to the game. Even though I would say I still recommend the game to the average steam gamer, it is far from a game I would want to take seriously and  have it be my primary game. This game has many balance issues that a new player would probably not notice and would just glance over. However someone who has accumulated this many hours would start to see the game in a more negative light, and realize the game's downsides. DO NOT main this game. Play once in a while, play it with friends to have a fun time. The second you start to take the game more seriously, you will realize just how flawed and the many balance issues this game has. Scott Jund the content creator has a ton of videos talking about just how awful the game is in terms of balance, and how behind the developers are in terms of fixing the game and communicating with the player base. Should you still buy/play the game? Sure, but don't take this game to heart. It is far from the ideal game it should be, because developers just don't know what they're doing. 


OLD REVIEW:
After playing this game for more than 2 years and approaching 3 years, here are my thoughts about this game. It is without a doubt that I still enjoy the game. The reason why I enjoy it so much lies within playing with friends and constantly improving your own play. The smallest things I want to perfect and play well keeps my interest. Yes, you can argue there are certain mechanics, powers, and perks in the game that makes it feel unfair or unjust. No, this game is not perfectly balanced. However there are many aspects of the game where if you played just a little bit better it would have made an impact in the match. Using and applying your knowledge to outplay and outwit the other side feels satisfying especially when it works out. Instead of raging at what the other side has done to you, look at what you yourself could've done better because that is what you have control over. With that being said, if you do not have the right mentality, you will burn out of the game quick.

The game has a certain demanding skill cap where it can be punishing towards beginners. Not knowing any of the fundamentals regarding objectives and chase interaction can be frustrating for both sides because you will constantly lose. This makes it easily frustrating and rage inducing. In the end, the fun from this game is what you make of it. If you learn and self improve, then you'll enjoy it. If you rage after every match, then you will burn out fast. I will admit that the community isn't great asmost people are biased to the whichever side they main. Play with a good mentality, lose the salt and salt from other toxic players, and you will have a fun time.

I've never really left reviews on anything. But this steaming pile of garbage deserves to just be deleted off the internet. The recent changes have made the game somewhat impossible to enjoy. 

Between the Bugs, Getting stuck on terrain unable to move until your downed / hooked, getting hit around behind corners or walls, Getting hit 20 yards away from the killer, Every killer having a (Expose) mechanic *1 shot knock down* or just complete map awareness the entire game with BBQ+Chilli, Healing, 2 Gen...etc it's next to impossible to even play the games natural state of *Hide a Seek* as the killer most likely knows exactly where you are at all times.

Then the match making... oh my holy fuck. Players new to the game been put with Rank 1 Killers and vise versa. Making it almost impossible to enjoy a match due to the miss matched skill level across to board. Not to mention the cross play. PC players getting matched with Mobile players... in a game like this? lol memes.

Don't want to play with console players? turn cross play off to Enjoy for 30 minute to an hour wait at times... Which goes to show that the PC community is just over it.

Now if you can get past ALL of the above, The final boss is Crash to Desktop. WHICH if you're in a match it will de-rank you and remove your items.

And if you're still not convinced?, Go watch the hour and hours of players having the same issues.

The game is a really cool concept, The play loop of it COULD be really fun, However, this has been the only game EVER to make me uninstall and write a review based on how disappointed I've been with this experience.

Maybe they will get it right with DBD 2? who knows.

-------------------------------------

EDIT: Reinstalled to try the new patch in hopes things might have been better. Nope, Only worse. Hex totems spawn in places you can reach them, Hatches spawn in places where your characters animation can't play out so you just float in the middle of the air and do nothing while trying to open a hatch. 

Not sure if links are allowed but here's an example of an unreachable Hex Totem - https://imagizer.imageshack.com/img923/9061/eQAf1N.jpg

Balance is no different if not worse. New hero comes with a massive amount of map presence and MORE expose mechanics.

When I read all the stories about broken, unwanted, unfair content been patched into the game that no one asks for... I now understand. This dev man... awful, Everyone that plays this REALLY wants it to be good, they just keep missing the mark... by a long shot.

Oh, Game looks more shiny with graphics update... About the only good thing the games seen in a while, Clap for that I guess.

I would really like to say I recommend this game because I really do like the game at its core, but I can't with good conscience do so. 

In Dead By Daylight, you can play as either one of 4 survivors or a killer in what basically amounts to a glorified game of tag mixed with  hide and seek. While the first few dozen matches are genuinely thrilling and scary, the grind, reliance on spending money, and the very apparent lack of balancing, performance and quality quickly makes the game lose its luster. 

This game is probably one of the grindiest games I have ever played, requiring hundreds of hours to max out survivors and killer, and the paid battle pass offered each season makes the grind even worse, requiring players to go out of their way to complete challenges that are sometimes unreasonable and difficult in order to get the rewards for the season. Many players feel pressured into buying tiers in the battle pass just to complete it. 

One of the biggest problems with this game is how stale it becomes to play over time. Most people who play killer will run the same 10-12 perks on their characters, regardless of their power because the game's balance is so out of whack, that it becomes tedious, difficult, or sometimes impossible to win without running them, despite there being almost 90 perks for killers, and even more for survivors. 

Most perks are also locked behind paid DLC, Each character, both killers and survivors, comes with 3 unique perks, and must be owned to unlock them. With some characters being available for purchase only with the game's premium currency (Auric Cells, not to be confused with the in-game currency iridescent shards) many people are forced to purchase characters with their money so they can maintain a competitive advantage, as unlocking a character with iridescent shards can take hundreds of hours, and licensed characters can only be purchased with Auric Cells for real money. 

Dead By Daylight is also riddled with bugs and glitches, many of which have persisted for months or even years with no fixes. The developers of the game appear to be more concerned with pumping out paid DLC's every 3 months than actually fixing the game. Rather than rolling back updates and working on fixes or delaying updates in order to make sure they aren't broken on launch, they continue push $10-15 cosmetics and their $10 battle pass, along with all of their paid DLC's without properly addressing the issues that were raised during Player Test Builds (whose purpose was to identify and flag these bugs for fixing before release).

While I love the gameplay of Dead By Daylight, the lack of attention to the community, the refusal to slow down to fix the game, and the egregious monetization practices the developers employ stops me from really wanting to recommend this game to anyone.

Extremely fun, so much variety that every single match can be totally different for *checks game time* 1000 hours as of this writing. Both sides are a ton of fun to play and have tons of depth. Its not a perfect game and its absolutely not for everyone, but there's an extremely deep well of fun to draw from with this game, and its updated every 6 weeks. 

The first 50 matches are everyones roughest, so if you start playing and feel like you just don't get it, keep going! Watching some streamers or youtubers and keep going and one day it'll just click for you.
